basics.name: William Hatcher
basics.label: System Architect & Software Developer
basics.objective: Accomplished developer with a focus on customer experience in software and communication. Possesses 3+ years of experience in large software projects, and contributions to over a dozen open source projects.

work.summary: System Architect for cybersecurity research lab at Texas A&M University. Led multiple teams in software development and virtualization clusters.
highlights: Deployed and maintained over 10 servers and desktops running Linux and Windows.
Managed various VM deployments for short- and long-term research projects
Designed and implemented the lab's network architecture including VPN tunnels, VLANs, firewall ACLs, and L3 switch configs on Cisco gear and pfSense/OPNsense firewalls.
Led a five person team developing CyberExpert: a tool for managing virtual labs in academia.
Designed and developed a robust, multi-node cyber range on Proxmox.
Full stack developer with experience in various front-end, back-end technologies, multiple DB engines (SQL and No-SQL), and security and monitoring.

work.summary: Creator of the best Discord translate bot
highlights: Combined multiple ML translation services to support 120+ languages.
Learned MongoDB management skills through deploying a secured MongoDB server.
Built a robust Python application to translate 10 million monthly characters across nearly 20 thousand servers.
Leveraged a Redis cache to cut resource utilization in half.

work.summary: Assisted hall directors in day-to-day tasks, aided in creating a positive learning and living environment through student engagement, social and educational programming, and acting as a point of contact for residents.
highlights: Developed and ran 4 successful student engagement programs
Contributed ideas to improve residence experience and RA satisfaction
Learned effective communication skills by engaging with students throughout both semesters.
Created a website to track RA performance points during the semester which was used daily.

work.position: Tier II Network Tech Support for Comcast
Electronics, School Supplies, and Toys Associate

projects.name: Wheeler Points
projects.description: Leaderboard website which tracks positive and negative performance points given to RAs.
highlights: RAs can log in to see reasons for points given and taken
Admin interface to add point entries
Can be generalized to provide a private leaderboard for any usecase
Code available upon request

projects.name: CyberExpert
projects.description: Virtual lab management software for academica developed at iSTAR.
highlights: Project Manager of five person cross-functional team.
Modular hypervisor interface to enable support for multiple hypervisors.
Developed with Supabase.
Supports SSO.
